title: Hiroshima Flower Festival
text:
The is a <a href="flower">flower</a> festival held annually in <a href="Hiroshima">Hiroshima</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
Overview.
The Hiroshima Flower Festival has been held every year since 1977 during <a href="Golden%20Week%20%28Japan%29">Golden Week</a>, from 3 May to 5 May.
More than one million people take part in the festival each year.
The festival includes multiple <a href="Stage%20%28theatre%29">stages</a> for entertainment, <a href="retail">shop</a>s, a small <a href="zoo">zoo</a>, and other amusement attractions along <a href="Peace%20Boulevard%20%28Hiroshima%29">Peace Boulevard</a> and in <a href="Hiroshima%20Peace%20Memorial%20Park">Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park</a>. Many <a href="concert">concert</a>s, <a href="Dance">dancing</a> shows, <a href="fashion%20show">fashion show</a>s, <a href="talk%20show">talk show</a>s, and <a href="tradition">tradition</a>al and <a href="contemporary">contemporary</a> performances featuring local citizens and other events are held throughout the area. Locals also participate in a <a href="parade">parade</a>, and <a href="Yosakoi">Yosakoi</a> dance on Peace Boulevard.
History.
The origin of the festival is the Japanese professional <a href="baseball">baseball</a> "<a href="Central%20League">Central League</a> Champion" parade for the <a href="Hiroshima%20Toyo%20Carp">Hiroshima Toyo Carp</a> team in 1975.
